lead_paragraph: Despite renewed attention to the use of starvation as a weapon of war by the Syrian government and rebels alike, accountability is arguably more elusive.
snippet: Despite renewed attention to the use of starvation as a weapon of war by the Syrian government and rebels alike, accountability is arguably more elusive.

headline.main: Starvation in Syria Galvanizes U.N., but Accountability Seems Distant as Ever
headline.print_headline: Syria Starvation Galvanizes U.N., but Accountability Seems as Distant as Ever

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

abstract: News Analysis; civil war in Syria has appeared to change global view of what is acceptable in war, as widespread starvation in country has shown; while United Nations Secretary Gen Ban Ki-moon decried starvation of civilians as war crimes, Security Council has made no move toward referring those responsible to International Criminal Court in The Hague.
